list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Exercise gives you a good appetite.

list_ex_of_english: She manages to deliver the key elements in a manner which whets the appetite without either over- or under-facing her readers.
A set of volumes like this whets the appetite for more information.
If the child has lost his appetite, they are told to go outdoors to get it back!
A number of interesting correlated responses have been observed between the two lines, including large differences in appetite.
For what was modern capitalism itself but the disordered appetite of man written on the communal body?
However, over one-third said their appetites were bigger, against only a few who said they were less.
The impact of these deficiencies on growth may, in part, derive from their influence on appetite.
There were many spectacles during the nineteenth century, feeding a public appetite for the latest thrilling news, whether polar or not.
